newsitem.title: UK: Euro vegoils ends mixed, palm oil firmer.
newsitem.headline: Euro vegoils ends mixed, palm oil firmer.

text.p: European vegetable oils ended mixed but the palm oil sector firmed on the back of news of a forthcoming tender for palm oils by Egypt.
News that Egypt was to tender for 25,000 tonnes of Malaysian and/or Indonesian palm stearin and palm oil on June 25 for August delivery prompted short-covering.
At the close the palm oils were $5 to $7.50 above Tuesday's finish. During the afternoon palm olein traded Jun at $560 and Aug/Sep at $550.
Soft oils fell back from midday levels as early losses were noted on the Chicago soybean oil futures. At the close they stood mainly 0.25 to 0.75 guilders down.
No trade was reported for soy oil, but rape oil did attract the one trade at 103.25 guilders per 100 kilos for Aug/Oct.
Coconut ended $2.50 to $7.50 lower, with light business ranging from May/Jun at $640 per tonne to $635 for Jul/Aug.
